intro: Arjona pungens, commonly known as the spiky arjona, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Arjona pungens is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its distinctive appearance.
